Article Title: The meaning of Maidaan, Muslim heroes in current-day India
Article Text: “Football hota kyaa hai, miyaan?” Tulsidas Balaram would ask, voice feeble yet indignant over a telephone line crackling with static. It was in those lonely days of the lockdown that we would talk, conversations echoing in the stillness of an arrested outside world, with him often repeating the rhetorical question as if he was reminding himself of the simple truths of his times.Balaram had just been bereaved in a sense. Chuni Goswami following PK Banerjee to the maidaan in the skies within 40 days of each other four years ago, would leave him, then 83, as the last of the Golden Trio of Indian football . The passing of the twin icons of a rich and varied Kolkata cultural landscape evoked spontaneous grief and a wave of nostalgia not often seen in Indian sport.Yet, it didn’t seem to have sunk in with Indian football’s eternal loner. Balaram was still happier talking about Rahim-saab, India’s father-figure coach, a Hyderabadi, who discovered him as a poor but wildly talented youngster in a Secunderabad village, recalling with child-like wonder about a sport that had yet to know globalization and about a life steeped in the socialist, working-class ethos of 1950s India. Because he would continue, “Gola lo, gola do. Bas. Football is a very simple game, yaar.”Maidaan, the biopic of Syed Abdul Rahim , Indian football’s most-storied coach, released earlier this month, reminds us of that gentler, tolerant India. Despite being simplistic in its interpretation -- the filmmaker avoids showing the Pakistani hockey team famously cheering for India in the 1962 final -- the film couldn’t be more timely. For it, nevertheless raises a crucial question for today’s India: What is it to be a Muslim leader of an Indian national sports team.The 1962 Asian Games gold medal victory is the undisputed high noon of Indian football. Crucially also, in 1962, India had barely lived 15 years as an independent nation -- everyone above 24-25 years old then would have had a distinct memory of Partition and the fear it spawned among them even if they had not been victims. The scars would have been still raw and widespread across a young nation.Yet, despite the violence and the bloody exodus, the spark of hope and the desire to forge a plural, multicultural India burnt bright. The leaders of the day recognised the importance of inclusion and the need to assuage fears. In a precious nugget, with India on the cusp of independence, the Partition looming, in 1946, Nehru, seeking to portray an image of secular India, is understood to have intervened to push for Iftikhar Ali Khan Pataudi to be captain of the Indian cricket team. The political action is both a salute to sport as a symbol of popular culture and to the fact that he could identify that Muslims were a little anxious about their future following the violence of Partition.Legend has it that in the 1920s, the affluent Rana family spotted on Lahore streets a young boy with exceptional cricketing abilities. When it was discovered that his impoverished Brahmin family could not afford his cricketing dreams, he was swiftly ‘adopted’ by the curious Ranas. The Hindu lad growing up in a Muslim household would go on to become independent India’s first cricket captain. We all knew of Lala Amaranth, we are today in danger of forgetting the deep pluralistic influences in how Lala – and for that matter, Balaram -- was shaped.Rahim’s great team – a Sikh, Bengalis, Hyderabadis, a Keralite, a Tamilian, a Goan and a couple of Kannadigas, even a Dehradun local of Nepalese origin – was a microcosm of a fledgling India, with all its curiosities, doubts and hopes and where everyone remembered to have the other’s back. The syncretic ethos of that team and the times speaks to us about a syncretism that is eroding at a rapid pace today.Mohd Shami, a proven match-winner for India is today obscenely trolled if he has a poor moment in the field and India loses, questions asked of his Indian-ness just because the cricketer happens to be Muslim, an accusation that is not hurled at Rahim every time his team loses. In the film too when the establishment cravenly conspires to oust Rahim, it is never on basis of his religion but on the mistaken idea that his teams have a poor Bengali representation.Somewhere between the true story of SA Rahim and the real-life trolling of Shami, lies Chak De! India, a fictional take on the trial and eventual redemption of Kabir Khan . It takes a more nuanced look at what it means to be a Muslim player, worse a Muslim player who misses a goal, and lives bearing that cross. It portrays the hurt of a man whose religion is blamed for his one misstep on the field, and his cathartic personal salvation.In 2007, Chak! De symbolized a particular kind of popular culture emerging to challenge the threats that were already beginning to show, Muslims being told to go to Pakistan at the slightest pretext was being normalized. The cinematic story of Kabir Khan was an attempt to paper over the increasing wedge between communities.Resurrecting that kind of a film, over 15 years since it was first made and swiftly attained cult status, would have seemed a challenge today, a Muslim being allowed to prove his patriotism would seem unlikely in a time where bigotry is in full-frontal attack and an entire community is not only being excluded, they are also being demonized.In any kind of political action, exclusion of any group of people becomes a moral issue. The offline trolling and ostracization that Kabir Khan had to face is today seen in so many ways, real and virtual, off screen and on. A slew of production-slick propaganda films in recent years have outrightly projected distorted truths and further deepened faultlines, where demonising the Muslim is the chief narrative and sole purpose of making the films.Now, here you have a film where you go back in time to dig out a true sporting story but are forced to exhume a true Muslim hero in the process. It turns on its head the credo of the films of the day where the message is forcibly clear: You can’t trust a Muslim.Despite cinematic licence allowing for the odd inaccuracy in the film, there is no larger distortion possible in Rahim’s story or to the 1962 victory, and that immediately makes for tricky navigation for today’s trolls – you have to hail a film where the Tricolour flies high and proud giving wing to nationalism, but you also are confronted with the strange dilemma of watching a Muslim lead us to it all. This delicious confusion is perhaps the real victory of the film.Because in telling us about Rahim, a Muslim guiding light, helming arguably India’s greatest-ever football team, maybe in Maidaan, we may have reminded ourselves where the many real-life Kabir Khans of our times reside in our midst, and how inclusion is like a football match. Like Balaram, that sworn Rahim disciple, would always remind us, “It’s very simple, yaar.”
Article Summary: Maidaan, the biopic of Syed Abdul Rahim, released earlier this month, reminds us of that gentler, tolerant India. Rahim’s great team – a Sikh, Bengalis, Hyderabadis, a Keralite, a Tamilian, a Goan and a couple of Kannadigas, even a Dehradun local of Nepalese origin – was a microcosm of a fledgling India.

Article Title: Manchester City's Pep Guardiola named Premier League Manager of the Year
Article Text:
(With Reuters inputs)

Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola was named Premier League Manager of the Year on Tuesday after leading the team to an unprecedented fourth consecutive title.The Spanish coach has now won the award five times since joining the club in 2016. With six league titles, he is tied as the second-most successful coach in the history of English football."This award reflects the hard work and excellence of the people at the Club in all departments," Guardiola said."I am so proud to be manager of this group of players and work alongside the brilliant coaches and support staff every day."Winning four titles in a row is one of the proudest achievements of my career. This is the toughest league in the world and our competitors have played some incredible football."Guardiola outperformed Arsenal's Mikel Arteta, Aston Villa's Unai Emery, Bournemouth's Andoni Iraola and Liverpool's Juergen Klopp to claim the award.
Article Summary: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola named Premier League Manager of the Year. Guardiola has now won the award five times since joining the club in 2016. With six league titles, he is tied as the second-most successful coach in the history of English football.

Article Title: Mauricio Pochettino leaves Chelsea after just one season in charge
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Mauricio Pochettino 's tenure as Chelsea manager has come to an end after a single season, with the club announcing the decision as mutual.Despite a strong finish to the campaign, the Blues fell short of their objectives, securing a sixth-place finish in the Premier League but failing to qualify for the Champions League or claim any silverware.The club released a statement on Tuesday confirming the news, expressing gratitude for Pochettino's efforts during his brief stint at the helm. While the team's performance improved in the latter stages of the season, it was not enough to meet the high expectations set by the club's hierarchy and fanbase."Chelsea FC can confirm that the club and Mauricio Pochettino have mutually agreed to part ways," Chelsea said in a statement.Chelsea's American ownership group, led by Todd Boehly , co-owner of the LA Dodgers, and Clearlake Capital , a private equity firm, has invested over £1 billion ($1.3 billion) in new talent since taking control just two years ago.Pochettino attributed the team's inconsistent performance to a combination of factors, including a lack of experience among the players and a significant number of injuries.Despite these challenges, Chelsea demonstrated their potential by reaching the finals of both the League Cup and the FA Cup, narrowly losing 1-0 to Liverpool and Manchester City, respectively.The team's strong finish to the season, with five straight victories, secured their place in European competition for the upcoming year.They will qualify for the Europa League if Manchester United lose to City in the FA Cup final and the Conference League if the Red Devils shock the English champions."Thank you to the Chelsea ownership group and sporting directors for the opportunity to be part of this football club's history," said Pochettino."The club is now well positioned to keep moving forward in the Premier League and Europe in the years to come."Chelsea sporting directors Laurence Stewart and Paul Winstanley said: "On behalf of everyone at Chelsea, we would like to express our gratitude to Mauricio for his service this season."He will be welcome back to Stamford Bridge any time and we wish him all the very best in his future coaching career."
Article Summary: Mauricio Pochettino's tenure as Chelsea manager has come to an end after a single season. The club announced the decision as mutual. Chelsea finished sixth in the Premier League but failed to qualify for the Champions League or claim any silverware. The team reached the finals of both the League Cup and the FA Cup.

Article Title: Salah hints at Liverpool stay, targets trophies next season
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

Mohamed Salah , the prolific Liverpool forward, has unequivocally declared that he and his teammates "will fight like hell" to secure silverware in the forthcoming season.The Egyptian maestro's resolute statement serves as a tantalizing hint that he will, at the very least, honor the ultimate year of his current contract at the iconic Anfield stadium.Speculation has been rife about Salah's future, with persistent rumors linking him to a potential move to the lucrative Saudi Pro League. Reports suggest that Liverpool had purportedly rebuffed an eye-watering £150m bid from Al-Ittihad for the 31-year-old dynamo back in September."We know that trophies are what count and we will do everything possible to make that happen next season," Salah posted on social media."Our fans deserve it and we will fight like hell."Liverpool secured the League Cup trophy during Jurgen Klopp 's concluding campaign as manager. However, they fell short in their pursuit of the Premier League, FA Cup, and Europa League titles.With Klopp's exit following an eight-year tenure at the helm of Liverpool, uncertainties have arisen regarding the future of several key players who flourished under his guidance.Virgil van Dijk and Trent Alexander-Arnold are also entering the final year of their contracts.On Monday, Liverpool officially announced Arne Slot , the former Feyenoord manager, as Klopp's successor.
Article Summary: Mohamed Salah says Liverpool will "fight like hell" to win trophies next season. The Egyptian forward is entering the final year of his contract at Anfield. Speculation has been rife about Salah's future, with persistent rumors linking him to a potential move to the lucrative Saudi Pro League.

Article Title: Cristiano Ronaldo poised for Euro record as Portugal name squad
Article Text:
Squad:

Goalkeepers: Diogo Costa (Porto), Rui Patricio Roma/ITA), Jose Sa (Wolves/ENG)

Defenders: Joao Cancelo (Barcelona/ESP), Nelson Semedo (Wolves/ENG), Diogo Dalot (Manchester United/ENG), Nuno Mendes (Paris Saint-Germain/FRA), Ruben Dias (Manchester City/ENG), Antonio Silva (Benfica), Goncalo Inacio (Sporting), Pepe (Porto), Danilo Pereira (Paris Saint-Germain/FRA)

Midfielders: Joao Palhinha (Fulham/ENG), Ruben Neves (Al-Hilal/KSA), Joao Neves (Benfica), Vitinha (Paris Saint-Germain/FRA), Otavio Monteiro (Al Nassr/KSA), Bruno Fernandes (Manchester United/ENG), Bernardo Silva (Manchester City/ENG)

Forwards: Cristiano Ronaldo (Al Nassr/KSA), Rafael Leao (AC Milan/ITA), Joao Felix (FC Barcelona/ESP), Goncalo Ramos (Paris SG/FRA), Diogo Jota (Liverpool/ENG), Pedro Neto (Wolves/ENG), Francisco Conceicao (Porto)

(With AFP inputs)

Cristiano Ronaldo is set to make history by setting a new Euro record after being named in Portugal 's 26-man squad for Euro 2024 , announced on Tuesday by coach Roberto Martinez .The 39-year-old, five-time Ballon d'Or winner will participate in his 11th major international tournament.His first appearance was at Euro 2004, and he will be making a record sixth appearance at the men's continental championship.Ronaldo secured a winner's medal at Euro 2016 in France, despite leaving the final injured after 25 minutes.Currently playing for Al Nassr in Saudi Arabia, Ronaldo holds the men's world record for both caps (206) and international goals (128).He was instrumental in Portugal's flawless qualifying campaign, where they won all 10 matches, scoring 36 goals and conceding just two. Ronaldo contributed significantly with 10 goals in nine qualifying appearances.Praising "a player who has scored 42 goals in 41 matches for his club", Martinez said he felt that the striker continued to offer "a quality in front of goal that we really appreciate and need".Despite his advancing years, Ronaldo will not be the oldest player in Portugal's Euro 2024 squad. His former Real Madrid teammate,Pepe , who is now 41 and plays for Porto, has also been included due to his "important role in the dressing room," according to Martinez.Portugal, placed in Group F, will face the Czech Republic, Turkey, and Georgia from June 14 to July 14 in Germany. Before the tournament, the Selecao will play warm-up matches against Finland, Croatia, and Ireland.In attack, Martinez has selected a formidable lineup alongside Ronaldo, including strikers Rafael Leao, Joao Felix , and Goncalo Ramos, as well as wingers Pedro Neto and Francisco Conceicao.The creative midfield will feature Bernardo Silva, fresh off winning the English Premier League title with Manchester City, and Bruno Fernandes of Manchester United.
Article Summary: Cristiano Ronaldo is set to make history by setting a new Euro record after being named in Portugal's 26-man squad for Euro 2024. The 39-year-old, five-time Ballon d'Or winner will participate in his 11th major international tournament. His first appearance was at Euro 2004, and he will be making a record sixth appearance at the men's continental championship.

Article Title: Marcus Rashford left out of England's provisional Euro 2024 squad
Article Text:
Squad:

Goalkeepers: Dean Henderson, Jordan Pickford, Aaron Ramsdale, James Trafford

Defenders:

Jarrad Branthwaite, Lewis Dunk, Joe Gomez, Marc Guehi, Ezri Konsa, Harry Maguire, Jarell Quansah, Luke Shaw, John Stones, Kieran Trippier, Kyle Walker

Midfielders: Trent Alexander-Arnold, Conor Gallagher, Curtis Jones, Kobbie Mainoo, Declan Rice, Adam Wharton

Forwards: Jude Bellingham, Jarrod Bowen, Eberechi Eze, Phil Foden, Jack Grealish, Anthony Gordon, Harry Kane, James Maddison, Cole Palmer, Bukayo Saka, Ivan Toney, Ollie Watkins

(With Reuters inputs)

Forward Marcus Rashford was the most notable exclusion as England manager Gareth Southgate named his provisional Euro 2024 squad on Tuesday, with experienced midfielder Jordan Henderson also left out.The provisional squad of 33 includes several uncapped players: Liverpool duo Curtis Jones and Jarell Quansah, Everton defender Jarrad Branthwaite, and Crystal Palace's Adam Wharton.Southgate will reduce the squad to 26 by the June 7 deadline.Rashford's and Henderson's omissions were particularly surprising given Southgate's previous loyalty to them and their significant roles in past tournaments. Rashford, 26, has earned 60 caps and scored 17 goals, including three at the 2022 World Cup in Qatar, but he has struggled with form this season, netting only seven Premier League goals for Manchester United .Chelsea forward Raheem Sterling was also left out, whereas his teammate Cole Palmer made the provisional list following an excellent season. Despite a long injury spell, Manchester United's Luke Shaw is included in the provisional squad.
Article Summary: England manager Gareth Southgate names provisional Euro 2024 squad. Marcus Rashford, Jordan Henderson, Raheem Sterling and Luke Shaw all left out. Southgate will reduce the squad to 26 by the June 7 deadline. Liverpool duo Curtis Jones and Jarell Quansah, Everton defender Jarrad Branthwaite, and Crystal Palace's Adam Wharton make the provisional squad.

Article Title: Scotland vs Israel Women's Euro qualifiers to be played behind closed doors
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

Scotland's Women's Euro 2025 qualifiers against Israel will be held in empty stadiums due to intelligence indicating "planned disruptions," Scottish football officials announced on Tuesday.The matches are scheduled for Hampden Park in Glasgow on May 31, with the "away" fixture set to take place in Hungary on June 4.This decision is made in the context of the most violent Gaza war to date.The conflict began following Hamas's attack on October 7, prompting a significant Israeli retaliation that has resulted in a spiraling civilian death toll and extensive destruction throughout Gaza."Due to updated intelligence and following extensive security consultations with all key parties, the Scottish FA regrets to confirm that the forthcoming qualifier between Scotland and Israel at Hampden Park on May 31 will now be played behind closed doors," said a statement from the Scottish Football Association .It added: "The stadium operations team were alerted to the potential for planned disruptions to the match and as a consequence we have no option but to play the match without supporters in attendance."
Article Summary: Scotland's Women's Euro 2025 qualifiers against Israel will be held in empty stadiums due to intelligence indicating "planned disruptions," Scottish football officials announced on Tuesday. The matches are scheduled for Hampden Park in Glasgow on May 31, with the "away" fixture set to take place in Hungary on June 4.

Article Title: Former Germany defender Karl-Heinz Schnellinger dies at 85
Article Text:
(With inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Former German defender Karl-Heinz Schnellinger , who represented his country at four World Cups, passed away in Italy on Monday evening at the age of 85, according to his former club Cologne .The announcement was made on Tuesday.Schnellinger, who had stints with AC Milan and AS Roma, was widely regarded as one of the world's top defenders during his playing career.Deutsche Welle, a German broadcaster, reported that he was in hospital at the time of his death.Schnellinger scored a stoppage-time equaliser for West Germany in their 4-3 semi-final loss to Italy in the 1970 World Cup, a match dubbed the "Game of the Century" due to a record five goals scored during extra time.It would be Schnellinger's fourth and last World Cup after 1958, 1962 and 1966. It was also his only goal in 47 international matches.At a time when international transfers were rare, Schnellinger spent most of his career in Italy, where he was known as "Carlo il Biondo" (the blond Karl). He won the Serie A title with Milan in 1968 before lifting the European Cup in 1969.
Article Summary: Karl-Heinz Schnellinger passes away in Italy at the age of 85. Former German defender represented his country at four World Cups. He had stints with AC Milan and AS Roma during his playing career. He scored a stoppage-time equaliser for West Germany in the 1970 World Cup.

Article Title: Germany's Toni Kroos to retire from football after Euro 2024
Article Text:
(With inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: German midfielder Toni Kroos will retire after the 2024 European Championship, his club Real Madrid said Tuesday.Madrid said the 34-year-old German international 'has decided to bring an end to his time as a professional footballer following Euro 2024 .'"My career as an active footballer will end this summer after the Euro championship," 34-year-old Kroos, who won the 2014 World Cup with Germany, said on Instagram.Before the European Championship, Kroos has a chance to win the Champions League with Real for a fifth time when they face Borussia Dortmund at Wembley on June 1.He also won the Champions League with Bayern Munich before joining the Spanish giants.Kroos joined Real in 2014 and quickly formed a formidable midfield partnership with Luka Modric.In a statement on their website, Real said Kroos "will go down in Real Madrid history as one of our club and international football's greatest legends".Kroos has also won the Liga title four times.
Article Summary: Toni Kroos will retire after the 2024 European Championship, his club Real Madrid say. The 34-year-old German international won the 2014 World Cup with Germany. Kroos has a chance to win the Champions League with Real for a fifth time.

Article Title: Novak Djokovic celebrates 37th birthday with refreshing win at Geneva Open
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Novak Djokovic marked his 37th birthday with a rejuvenating victory at the Geneva Open , paving his way to the quarter-finals and gearing up for his French Open title defence.The world number one triumphed over Germany's Yannick Hanfmann with a commanding 6-3, 6-3 win at the Parc des Eaux-Vives grounds.Seeking to regain his form, Djokovic opted for a wildcard entry into the Geneva tournament ahead of the French Open, aiming to address recent performance concerns.In a heartwarming moment, the crowd serenaded Djokovic with "Happy Birthday" as a birthday cake adorned with candles made its way onto the court post-match.Djokovic shared the celebratory moment with the crowd, taking a playful bite of the cake before offering slices to the ball boys and girls, spreading cheer and camaraderie on his special day.
Article Summary: Novak Djokovic beats Germany's Yannick Hanfmann in straight sets. The world number one is gearing up for his French Open title defence. The crowd serenaded him with "Happy Birthday" as a birthday cake adorned with candles made its way onto the court post-match.

Article Title: Former finalist Dominic Thiem out of French Open qualifiers
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Dominic Thiem , a two-time finalist at Roland Garros , suffered a disappointing defeat in the second round of qualifying on Wednesday. The Austrian player lost 6-2, 7-5 to Otto Virtanen of Finland.Since reaching the final in 2020, Thiem has struggled to advance beyond the first round of the main draw. His rankings have plummeted from World No.3 to 131 due to persistent wrist issues.Thiem's career highlight came in 2020 when he triumphed over Alexander Zverev in the US Open final, which was impacted by the Covid-19 pandemic. However, since that crowning achievement, his career has been on a downward trajectory.The 30-year-old has already declared his intention to retire from professional tennis at the conclusion of the 2024 season. Meanwhile, the main draw of the French Open is set to commence on Sunday.
Article Summary: Dominic Thiem loses 6-2, 7-5 to Otto Virtanen of Finland. Thiem has struggled to advance beyond the first round of the main draw. The 30-year-old has already declared his intention to retire from professional tennis at the conclusion of the 2024 season.

Article Title: Novak Djokovic eager to regain form ahead of French Open defence
Article Text:
(With Reuters inputs)

NEW DELHI: After recovering from an unusual injury this month, world number one Novak Djokovic is looking to gain some experience before defending his championship at Roland Garros this week at the Geneva Open.Djokovic hasn't won a title in 2024 and has had a difficult season.The 24-time Grand Slam champion lost to Casper Ruud in the Monte Carlo semifinals, which started a less than ideal preparation for the French Open .Two days after being struck in the head by a fan's water bottle while signing autographs, he decided not to play in the Madrid Open and instead lost in the Italian Open's third round.The Serbian told reporters on Tuesday that "the head is good," despite saying he felt off after his 6-2 6-3 loss to Alejandro Tabilo . Everything is good. After more than a week of training, I feel great."I've dedicated quite a bit of time with my new fitness coach to build the endurance, to build physical strength and capabilities that I need in order to play a best-of-five Grand Slam on the physically most demanding surface, which is clay."So, hopefully, I'm going to get more than one match here in Geneva, that's the goal and then let's see what happens in Paris."On Wednesday, Djokovic will play his opening match in Geneva against Yannick Hanfmann of Germany, who earlier in the event defeated three-time Grand Slam champion Andy Murray ."The reason why I chose to come and play is because I feel like, at this moment, there is no better practice for me than match play," Djokovic said."I feel like I need more matches, even if it's one match, two matches, three, four hopefully. It's good for me, because that's the way for me to try to find that kind of form that I need for Roland Garros."
Article Summary: World number one Novak Djokovic is looking to gain some experience before defending his championship at Roland Garros this week. The 24-time Grand Slam champion lost to Casper Ruud in the Monte Carlo semifinals. He decided not to play in the Madrid Open and instead lost in the Italian Open's third round.

Article Title: Novak Djokovic backs Rafael Nadal for French Open title
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Rafael Nadal , the 14-time French Open champion, has been struggling with fitness issues as he approaches the end of his illustrious career. However, Novak Djokovic , the world number one, believes that Nadal remains the favorite to win the upcoming French Open.Djokovic, who is currently preparing for the tournament at the Geneva Open , acknowledged that Nadal faces increasing competition from younger players.Nevertheless, he emphasized that as long as the Spaniard is in the draw, he cannot be discounted.The Serbian star's comments highlight the immense respect and admiration he has for Nadal's achievements and abilities on the clay courts of Roland Garros ."This year is more open," French Open defending champion Djokovic told reporters at the Parc des Eaux-Vives grounds in Geneva."Casper Ruud is surely one of the five players who are candidates to win. You have Alexander Zverev, Andrey Rublev, Stefanos Tsitsipas -- all the players who won a major tournament on this surface this year."But when you talk about Roland-Garros and Nadal is there, he is always the biggest favourite for me."After everything he has done on the courts at Roland-Garros, it's normal, respectfully, to put him as the biggest favourite."Obviously it's a little different with his level of play. But it's Roland-Garros, and it's Nadal."After that, maybe me, if I feel good, if I play well. At Roland-Garros, and all the Grand Slams, I am a bit of a different player."Djokovic, on the cusp of his 37th birthday on Wednesday, made a last-minute decision to participate in the Geneva tournament by accepting a wild card entry.His aim is to reverse a concerning decline in his performance as he prepares to defend his title at the French Open, which commences next week.The Swiss clay court event, featuring a compact draw of 28 players, acts as the ultimate preparation for the prestigious Grand Slam tournament.Djokovic, who holds an impressive record of 24 Grand Slam titles, is facing an unusual situation this year. He will enter the French Open without having secured a single title in the season, a first since 2018. However, a victory in Geneva could change that narrative.While time has caught up with 37-year-old Nadal, Djokovic said he was hungry to keep playing at the top."I'm searching for my highest possible level," he said."It's not an obligation. It's truly my desire, my feeling, my passion, my love for tennis. That's the most important. I'm seeking to stay connected with that feeling."Djokovic said he knew Geneva well as he has cousins in the Swiss city, though he has never played at the Geneva Tennis Club before."At this moment, there is no better practice for me than match play. So I feel like I need more matches," he said."That's the way for me to try to find the kind of form that I need for Roland-Garros."Djokovic was at the Stade de Geneve on Monday to witness Young Boys winning a 17th Swiss football championship with a 1-0 victory over hosts Servette -- a team the Serb has a long-standing fondness for.Djokovic said one of his cousins was set to marry a Servette player -- French midfielder Timothe Cognat, according to Swiss media.Djokovic's best friend, and best man at his wedding, was defender Neven Markovic, who played for Servette from 2013 to 2015."That's why I'm supporting the club," Djokovic said, jovially adding that Markovic could perhaps best be categorised as a "very physical player"."I'm not a football expert -- but he's a crazy guy," he said.
Article Summary: Novak Djokovic believes Rafael Nadal is the favorite to win the French Open. The world number one is currently preparing for the tournament at the Geneva Open. Nadal has been struggling with fitness issues as he approaches the end of his career.

Article Title: Andy Murray comeback ends in Geneva defeat
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: The highly anticipated possibility of another match between Andy Murray and Novak Djokovic vanished on Tuesday as Murray exited the Geneva Open , marking his comeback from an ankle injury.Murray, playing on a wild card, was trailing 7-5, 4-1 against Yannick Hanfmann when a thunderstorm interrupted play at Parc des Eaux-Vives on Monday. Resuming on Tuesday, the German world number 85 swiftly concluded the match, taking the second set 6-2 in just over 10 minutes.Since Friday's draw, tennis enthusiasts had hoped for what could have been the final encounter between two members of the legendary Big Four—Djokovic, Murray, Rafael Nadal, and the retired Roger Federer—who have dominated men’s tennis for the past two decades.Instead, Hanfmann will face world number one Djokovic in the second round on Wednesday.Currently ranked 75th, the 37-year-old Murray, who plays with a metal hip, has indicated he may retire from competitive tennis within a few months. Nadal, similarly beset by injuries, is also nearing the end of his career and is uncertain about participating in the upcoming French Open .The Geneva match marked Murray’s first tour-level appearance since he injured tendons in his left ankle in Miami in March. The 28-man Swiss clay court tournament is a crucial preparation event for the French Open, the year’s second Grand Slam.Djokovic, who turns 37 on Wednesday, entered Geneva with a wild card to address a concerning slump in form ahead of defending his French Open title next week. The 24-time Grand Slam champion risks arriving in Paris without a title this season for the first time since 2018 unless he wins in Geneva.The Geneva draw also features Casper Ruud, the Norwegian world number seven, and other top 20 players such as Taylor Fritz , Ben Shelton, and Sebastian Baez .Murray and Djokovic last faced each other in the 2017 Doha final, where the Serbian emerged victorious.Murray, a former world number one and three-time Grand Slam champion, won the US Open in 2012 and Wimbledon in 2013 and 2016, with 11 Grand Slam final appearances. He also secured Olympic singles titles in 2012 and 2016.
Article Summary: Novak Djokovic will face Yannick Hanfmann in the second round of Geneva Open. Andy Murray was playing on a wild card and was trailing 7-5, 4-1 when a thunderstorm interrupted play at Parc des Eaux-Vives. The match marked Murray’s first tour-level appearance since he injured tendons in his left ankle in March.

Article Title: Rafael Nadal returns to Roland Garros to practice amid doubts over his fitness and future
Article Text:
(Inputs from AP)

NEW DELHI: Rafael Nadal , the 14-time French Open champion, returned to Roland Garros to practice and assess his readiness for the upcoming tournament.The 37-year-old Spaniard arrived in the late afternoon with his coach, Carlos Moya, and a few sparring partners at the main stadium, Court Philippe Chatrier, which was open to the public.Approximately 6,000 fans were present at the stadium, enthusiastically cheering as Nadal stepped onto the court.The practice session lasted around an hour and a half, after which Nadal signed several autographs before exiting through a doorway leading to the locker rooms.The training session allowed Nadal to familiarize himself with the red clay at Roland Garros, as he hasn't played a match there in two years, and to evaluate his physical condition. Nadal has been recovering from a hip injury that required surgery and has caused him to miss most of the 2023 season, as well as dealing with issues related to a hip muscle and an abdominal muscle.Nadal's recent loss to Hubert Hurkacz at the Italian Open, with a score of 6-1, 6-3, left him uncertain about his readiness for the French Open. "Let's see what's going on, how I feel myself mentally tomorrow, after tomorrow, and in one week," Nadal said in Rome. "If I feel ready, I (am) going to try to be there and fight for the things that I have been fighting (for) the last 15 years, (even) if now (that) seems impossible."As of Monday, Nadal had not yet announced his decision regarding his participation in the French Open. This is expected to be his final season on tour, making this potentially his last appearance at a tournament he has won more times than any other tennis player has won any Grand Slam title. Nadal won the French Open in 2022, securing his 22nd major championship overall, which is second only to Novak Djokovic 's 24. He missed the French Open last year due to his hip injury.
Article Summary: Rafael Nadal returns to Roland Garros to practice and assess his readiness for the French Open. Nadal hasn't played a match there in two years, and to evaluate his physical condition. The Spaniard has been recovering from a hip injury that required surgery.

Article Title: AITA adds Ramkumar in the mix for Bopanna’s Olympic partner choice
Article Text: PUNE: The question of who would be Rohan Bopanna’s partner at the Paris Olympics got curiouser with the All India Tennis Association recommending Ramkumar Ramanathan ’s name out of turn for the TOPS programme.The latest list of tennis players to receive funding from the government towards preparation for the Paris Games comprises Bopanna (World No. 4 in doubles), Sumit Nagal (No.94 in singles) and Sriram Balaji (82 in doubles), besides Ramkumar (149 in doubles).It is reliably learnt that the Australian Open doubles champion Bopanna had suggested, at the AITA ’s instance in January, to include the two highest-ranked players for the purpose of TOPS funding and it would have been too early to identify a partner as such.Yuki Bhambri (ranked 60 at the end of January and currently 54) and Balaji (78 then), would have been the straightforward choice, with Ramkumar ranked outside the top-200.AITA honorary secretary Anil Dhupar said the 29-year-old Chennai lad’s name had been recommended keeping in mind his past success and service to the country as well as keeping the options open.“How do we know? Tomorrow Rohan might say he wants to play with Ram,” he said.Dhupar clarified that the AITA had forwarded a bunch of names, including that of Bhambri, to the Sports Authority of India (SAI).“We only recommend, the decision (as to whom to support) is with SAI. They directly deal with the players as to how much money each one gets,” he said.SAI did not respond to a detailed questionnaire on the issue despite repeated requests.‘FINAL DECISION WITH SELECTION COMMITTEE’Dhupar said the final decision as to who would be Bopanna’s partner will rest with the national selection committee.“The practice always has been that the player, who is confirmed by the ITF, will be asked about his choice and it will be discussed by the national selection committee. But it is the selection committee that takes the final call,” he said.Bopanna, who rose to World No. 1 after triumphing in Melbourne in the company of Matthew Ebden for his maiden Grand Slam success, chose to keep his cards close to the chest.“Once I go to Paris in the next couple of days, I will have a discussion with (coach) Scott (Davidoff) and then decide,” the 43-year-old Bopanna told TOI from Bengaluru.Yet, the choice could come down to Bhambri and Balaji considering they have been competing at a much higher level compared to the rest.“Yuki won (an ATP Tour title) in Munich and Bala won a 175 Challenger (beating Bhambri/Cabral and Erler/Miedler combinations on the way). Basically they are playing the ATP 250s,” Bopanna said.“Whoever the partner is, we will combine after Wimbledon (in the lead up to the Olympics). Playing on grass doesn’t make sense since it (tennis at the Paris Games) will be on clay,” he added.
Article Summary: AITA recommends Ramkumar Ramanathan’s name out of turn for TOPS programme. Sumit Nagal, Sriram Balaji and Rohan Bopanna also on list of tennis players to receive funding from the government towards preparation for Paris Games.
